headline: China's vice commerce minister met Apple COO on Friday
summary: China's Vice Commerce ​Minister Li ‌Chenggang and Apple's Chief ‌Operating Officer Sabih Khan discussed the U.S. firm's business ⁠operations in ‌China in a meeting on ‍Friday, a commerce ministry statement said on Monday. In ​the meeting, ‌Li said China will provide greater opportunities to foreign companies including Apple and ⁠he hoped ​Apple would ​continue to work with Chinese partners ‍and ⁠develop the Chinese market, according to ⁠the statement.

content.title: China's vice commerce minister met Apple COO on Friday
content.summary: China's Vice Commerce ​Minister Li ‌Chenggang and Apple's Chief ‌Operating Officer Sabih Khan discussed the U.S. firm's business ⁠operations in ‌China in a meeting on ‍Friday, a commerce ministry statement said on Monday. In ​the meeting, ‌Li said China will provide greater opportunities to foreign companies including Apple and ⁠he hoped ​Apple would ​continue to work with Chinese partners ‍and ⁠develop the Chinese market, according to ⁠the statement.

headline: Apple Fined $115 Million in Italy Over App Tracking Policy
summary: Italy’s competition watchdog fined  Apple  more than 98 million euros ($114.8 million), saying the company abused its dominance in the digital economy through its app-tracking transparency policy.  The AGCM said Monday that Apple imposes unfair privacy rules on app developers by requiring them to gain users’ consent to collect and use data for advertising through a specific prompt.  The watchdog said the prompt essentially forces app developers to ask for consent twice for the same purpose.

content.title: Apple Fined $115 Million in Italy Over App Tracking Policy
content.summary: Italy’s competition watchdog fined  Apple  more than 98 million euros ($114.8 million), saying the company abused its dominance in the digital economy through its app-tracking transparency policy.  The AGCM said Monday that Apple imposes unfair privacy rules on app developers by requiring them to gain users’ consent to collect and use data for advertising through a specific prompt.  The watchdog said the prompt essentially forces app developers to ask for consent twice for the same purpose.

headline: Market will be more volatile than 'patient' on AI CapEx
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are ticking up on Monday to start the shortened trading week. What is Wall Street's market outlook for 2026 as more experts consider the risk tied to certain variables, such as the debt profiles attached to the AI trade? The Wealth Alliance President and Managing Director Eric Diton shares his thoughts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
